column4: I can't seem to find any easycam2 packages or repositories for gutsy, can anyone link me or find some other way to help me out? ;x
check https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EasyCam
the only repo it gives is this: deb http://blognux.free.fr/ubuntu hardy main can i use that in gutsy?
I doubt it. It might be in backports, I suppose. You could always upgrade to hardy?
My wireless card doesn't work correctly in hardy, I just downgraded =\
Oh man, that sucks.
do some googling too. Someone might have built a gutsy version. You could always install from source, too.
just grab a source package http://blognux.free.fr/ubuntu/dists/hardy/main/source/ and compile?
would compiling a hardy package on gutsy work...?
you're compiling the source, not the package itself.
did you check backprots like I suggested/
it doesn't actually have any make files or anything o_0
lemme have a look, one tik.
are you SURE this is the only way you can install your cam?
nope, not even sure it would work, but supposedly it's generally the easiest option if it works.. :P
dynex webcam, don't know the make
it doesn't say anywhere? There's not a sticker on the bottom?
nope
lsusb gives this: Bus 002 Device 004: ID 05a9:8519 OmniVision Technologies, Inc.
check your home directory?
nope, not there
